title: App in "Offline" state is launched if open app via Push notification (with saved password)
body:
### Description

[comment]: # (Feature or Bug? i.e Type: Bug)
*Type*: Bug

[comment]: # (Describe the feature you would like, or briefly summarise the bug and what you did, what you expected to happen, and what actually happens. Sections below)
*Summary*: Offline state is shown for long time (10 minutes at least) if open app by tapping on push notification. password should be saved, so 1:1 chat is opened. Found on Android, can't test on iOS because no PNs are received on iOS when app is closed atm https://github.com/status-im/status-react/issues/7438

#### Expected behavior
[comment]: # (Describe what you expected to happen.)
1:1 chat is opened, app connects to mailserver and massage that triggered PN is shown
#### Actual behavior
[comment]: # (Describe what actually happened.)
1:1 chat is opened with Offline status, no new messages shown. Log contains

### Reproduction
[comment]: # (Describe how we can replicate the bug step by step.)

- Open Status, add someone as a contact
- log out, turn on "Save password until logout", log in
- close Status app
- get push notification from your contact who send text message in 1:1 chat with you
- tap on push notification, as a result Status app is launched, logs in automatically and 1:1 chat is shown
- check if it's connected to mailserver and if new message is shown in the chat


### Additional Information
[comment]: # (Please do your best to fill this out.)
* Status version: 0.9.34 nightly feb 25 and release 0.9.33
* Operating System: Android 9 and 6.0.1

it looks like we never sign in when we start the app from notifications
